snippet: Blindfolded experts who listened to violins made by old masters and high-quality modern instruments couldn’t tell the difference between them.
abstract: Study published by Claudia Fritz in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences finds that blindfolded violinists are unable to distinguish between legendary violins made by Stradivari or Guarneri del Gesu and modern instruments; study is welcomed by violin craftsman who have long held that the superiority of certain older violins is mythical.
lead_paragraph: Blindfolded experts who listened to violins made by old masters and high-quality modern instruments couldn’t tell the difference between them.

headline.seo: In Play-Off Between Old and New Violins, Stradivarius Lags
headline.main: In Classic vs. Modern Violins, Beauty Is in Ear of the Beholder
headline.print_headline: In Classic vs. Modern Violins, Beauty Is in Ear of the Beholder

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations
